question: Which city airport has been crowned the world's busiest among the single-runway facilities?
explanation: GVK group's Mumbai airport has been crowned the world's busiest among the single-runway facilities which handle 757 flights a day. Mumbai airport flew 45.2 million people in 2017. Of this, 12.4 million were international travellers. Mumbai handled only 18.6% of total air traffic in the country.
